slogan.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc
slogan.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: His campaign slogan was ‘Peace, stability and prosperity’.
The walls had political slogans daubed on them.
The company has dropped its original advertising slogan.
The Liberal Democrats were searching for a more catchy slogan.
They’ve come up with a good, snappy slogan for the product.
We want real progress, not just empty slogans.
Five youths were arrested after shouting anti-government slogans.
Dozens of demonstrators waved banners and chanted slogans.
a badge bearing a campaign slogan
slogan.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used by an advertiser, organization, or other group
slogan.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: We need an advertising slogan for the new campaign.
The Department of Commerce adopted a new slogan: ‘Customer Service Is Our Reason for Being’.
